column11: 'Size & Number of Speaker Array'
column13: 'Upload from spreadsheet:  PDT Discussions and Conclusions: As the number of speakers increase
column14: so will the construction and maintenance cost. Strive for modular design; redundancy; PDT Discussion on Likelihood and Impact: initial indication is the number of speakers can be reduced;; Risk Managment Discussion: Continued R&D; re-evaluate BR acoustics cross walked with data collected at Lock 19 for improvements;'

column11: 'Noise on barges'
column13: 'Upload from spreadsheet:  PDT Discussions and Conclusions: Acoustic barrier can potentially resonate in the empty barges due to hollow hulls creating nuisance.; PDT Discussion on Likelihood and Impact: Could interfere with communications between deckhands and captains; empty barges becoming an amplifier of the sound; may lose efficacy of deterrent system if volume levels must be lowered; impacts to public use of the adjacent area; Risk Managment Discussion: Continued R&D; collect data; evaluate affects on actual navigation vessels at Lock 19;'

column11: 'Single source for speakers
column13: null
column14: 'Upload from spreadsheet:  PDT Discussions and Conclusions: Single source production rate is very limited; sole source procurement required;; PDT Discussion on Likelihood and Impact: If we need to change to another source there will be an impact to design when it comes to housing size
column15: channel layout/recesses etc.; pulse acoustic technologies;; Risk Managment Discussion: conduct a sources sought of other speakers; development salient characteristics specifications;  laboratory testing of other systems; sources sought on salient conditions desired'

column11: 'Interaction with Bubble Curtain'
column13: 'Upload from spreadsheet:  PDT Discussions and Conclusions: Don''t know the effects air bubbles will have on sound; PDT Discussion on Likelihood and Impact: acoustic barrier performance may be diminished by bubble curtain;. Air normally effects sound propagation in water; two technologies combined have not included fish response; operational cost of air compressors at L19 in conjunction with acoustic testing; Risk Managment Discussion: Testing at Lock 19 with air bubble curtain on can be done to collect data; look at other sites testing bubble curtains (Barkley
column14: Peoria); look at funding OD for additional air compressor costs at testing sites'

column11: 'Operability
column13: sustainability'
column15: 'Upload from spreadsheet:  PDT Discussions and Conclusions: Acoustic system has not been tested for 25 or 50 yr. operation; PDT Discussion on Likelihood and Impact: Unknown until measured; increased maintenance and/or repair/replacement; Risk Managment Discussion: Test speakers for an extended period of time;  measure the success (durability and any degradation) at Locks 19 & 6;'

column11: 'Efficacy of Acoustics'
column13: 'Upload from spreadsheet:  PDT Discussions and Conclusions: Limited systems are being tested. One system is patented so we do not have the ability to test. Do we have the right system? Are fish responsive to the systems being tested in the field? We need to maintain at appropriate levels that do not disrupt navigation and local residence. Is it sustainable?; PDT Discussion on Likelihood and Impact: If it''s not affective
column14: may need to abandon concept for another deterrent system; R&D will take several years to reach conclusions; durability; sediment; Risk Managment Discussion: Continued R&D; MVR support of testing at L&D 19 test site'

column11: 'Ambient Noise'
column13: 'Upload from spreadsheet:  PDT Discussions and Conclusions: Ambient noise of the bridge could interfere with the acoustic deterrent; PDT Discussion on Likelihood and Impact: Bridge sounds overlapping with acoustic deterrent;; Risk Managment Discussion: ERDC is aware of the risk; Conduct additional sound testing at Brandon Road.'

column11: 'Interaction with electrical barrier'
column13: 'Upload from spreadsheet:  PDT Discussions and Conclusions: We don''t know what the effects the electric barrier or stray current will have on the speakers and their operation; PDT Discussion on Likelihood and Impact: May need a different speaker manufacturer
column14: different sound systems may be needed. There are concerns with stray currents frying the acoustic speakers;; Risk Managment Discussion: Test spare speakers in existing barrier to see impacts; collect field data on acoustics when they close the electric current; continued R&D;'

column11: 'The assumption made during the feasibility study was the site could be used for construction with some remediation. Environmental site investigation may result in unusable site or high cost.'
column13: 'PDT Discussions on likelihood and impact-The state is actively working to complete Phase II analyisis which includes sampling. It''s a formal industrial site and dredge placement site with unknown disposal with potential to high impacts to cost and schedule. There was a lawsuit regarding potential ground water contamination at various NRG sites. Note this risk is related to risk RE-1 Land Acquisition in two ways. First we are dependent on land access (Rights of Entry for Exploration) being acquired to conduct the investigation. If we do not get access then the Phase II analysis cannot be completed and the land acquisition for construction cannot be completed. Second the results of a Phase II investigation could dictate that it is not feasible to acquire the site which is essentially the risk concern of RE-1 Land Acquisition of the preferred site cannot be acquired.'
